text:
“What shall we sing?”  
“Something genteel,” she replied, glancing at Rodion.  
“We need a good song for money.”  
“Let’s go to Nevsky. More people will notice us.”  
Lida only knows ‘My Village.’  
“Not that! We need something better.”  
“Maybe ‘Cinq sous’ in French?”  
“Yes! It’ll show we’re well-born.”  
“Marlborough s’en va-t-en guerre,” she began.  
“Better ‘Cinq sous.’ Kolya, hands on hips!”  
“Cough, cough!” She straightened Polenka’s dress.  
“Now, let’s sing and clap!”  
“Cinq sous, cinq sous, pour monter notre menage!”  
They sang, hoping for coins.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The characters are preparing for a street performance, discussing what song to sing to attract attention and money.
